bibl.title: Letter from Royal S. Webster to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940

div1.p: Webster informs Hench that the railway company does not plan to remove a portion of the track near the Military Hospital. He thanks him for his kind remarks during Hench's address at the dedication of the memorial at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Royal S. Webster to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940
div1.opener:
FERROCARRILES UNIDOS DE LA HABANA
Y ALMACENES DE REGLA, LIMITADA
COMPAÑIA INTERNACIONAL
------
VIAS Y OBRAS
----
HABANA, Oct-24th, 1940.-
NUM.
Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
102-110 Second Ave. S.W.
Rochester - Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
We have taken up a portion of the track of
the Playa branch but have no intention at present of ta-
king up the part in the vecinity of the Military Hospital
in which you are interested. This track will probably re-
main in service for years to come as we have a siding
that is frequently used about a kilometer further on.

I wish to thank you for your kind referen-
ces to me in your address at the dedication of the Memo-
rial at Washington and Jefferson College and will appre-
ciate very much receiving a draft of your paper.

So far I have found no one who remembers
the bridge over our tracks.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, R S Webster
Divisional Engineer. RSW/RA.
